sentences.sContent: Liz realized that, despite herself, she cared about Edward.
sentences.sCn: 利兹发现自己不由自主地在乎爱德华。

sentences.sContent: ...have similar expectations of their children despite different 	ways of parenting...
...The report warns the picture on wages is likely to get worse this year despite indications of an economic rebound...
...who are suffering from the climate change impacts despite having scarcely contributed to the problem...
...for example--an increase of just one percent from the previous year despite a year of high-profile launches...
...despite the implementation of the Affordable Care Act...
...despite the multiple influences on becoming parents...
...Why are people reluctant to take on more debt despite the low interest rates...

trans.tranOther: if you do something despite yourself, you do it although you did not intend to
